alert.note: Alert for Inland Sussex; Kent (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 3:29AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Sussex, southwestern Kent, eastern Talbot and Caroline Counties through 400 AM EDT... At 329 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Denton, or 12 miles east of Easton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Denton, Harrington, Federalsburg, Bridgeville, Greensboro, Oakland, Ridgely, Trappe, Preston, Ellendale, Goldsboro, Queen Anne, Smithville, Jumptown, Agner, Choptank, Windyhill, Sandtown and Andrewsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
